column1: On 26 February  Grishnákh was part of a raiding party that captured Meriadoc Brandybuck and Peregrin Took at Parth Galen. He was the captain of a group of Mordor-orcs which had joined Uglúks forces on the plains of Rohan during the War of the Ring.  When Pippin awoke and heard the Orcs arguing he noted that Grishnákhs voice sounded softer but more evil than the others.  Grishnákh threatened to report the doings of the mountain-orcs and of Uglúk to Lugbúrz (Barad-dûr).
On 28 February Grishnákh and his followers split from Uglúks company to head east
column2: but fell back in with the Isengarders when Éomers riders drew near.  In the nighttime when he had a chance
column3: Grishnákh attempted to search the hobbits for the One Ring (how he knew about it is unknown; possibly he was present at the torture and interrogation of Gollum in Barad-dûr).  After hearing Pippin imitate Gollums croaking noise
column4: he believed they had the One Ring and tried to escape with the two hobbits.  Before he could accomplish this he was slain by the Riders of Éomer near the eaves of Fangorn Forest.

:No individual orcs are identified - or identifiable
column2: but one orc yells "Grishnákh" to another when they are surrounded by the Rohirrim. Meriadoc Brandybuck also tells one orc (as with the book) that if the Ring goes to Isengard there will be nothing "for poor Grishnákh".

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers:
:Grishnákh is played by Stephen Ure. He is a common orc who is crushed by Treebeard after he attempts to kill Merry and Peregrin Took.
2004: The Lord of the Rings: War of the Ring:
:Grishnákh is a captain in the evil faction. He is voiced by David Lodge.
